Comments_List: I've learned a lot of things about human osteology  from this class.

I developed a good knowledge of the morphology of the human skeleton and, in part, of the function of the various skeletal elements and portions of elements. I also developed quite advanced skills into the identification of complete and fragmentary skeletal human remains. Thus, I have acquired valuable insights into the practice of sorting, identifying and studying skeletal human remains. Having taken this class, I feel qualified to engage with these materials and expand my skills autonomously.
In depth overview of human osteology, and great lab sessions with very good specimens for students to learn.

Strengths: hands-on experience, lots of time with the material, relaxed and stimulating environment, adequate workload.
Weaknesses: none.
Possible improvements: different time balance across different modules (e.g. less time on the skull, more on the lower limb).
Yes, I would recommend! It is a must take class for those who are learning human osteology!
Yes. I would recommend this course to anyone who majors in biology, biological anthropology or archaeology.
